Properties.Name: Text
Properties.Value:
This Workflow connects Salesforce with Xero.
It pulls Orders from Salesforce, verifies if each has been processed, and retrieves associated Order Items and Account details.
If the corresponding customer doesnâ€™t exist in Xero, it maps the data and creates the customer before generating an invoice.
Each Order is logged with either a success or error status.

Nodes.Name: VariableBar
Nodes.LongDescription: Here we are setting the Group for the Key-Values

Nodes.Name: Formatter
Nodes.LongDescription: Here we display a message if the Customer ID has been found in the Key Values

Nodes.Name: SetKeyValue2
Nodes.LongDescription:
Here we are logging the Key Value record for successful records.
We get the Group from the Variable bar.
We use the Order ID as the Key (Notice the fx on the input - you need to select which field in the payload is the Key.)
We use the Xero InvoiceID as the Value.

Nodes.Name: Salesforce
Nodes.LongDescription: Here we are querying the Orders from Salesforce

Properties.Schema:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-16"?>
<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="Request" type="xs:string"/>
</xs:schema>
Properties.Name: Request
Properties.Value:
<Request>SELECT
	Id,
	OwnerId,
	ContractId,
	AccountId,
	Pricebook2Id,
	OriginalOrderId,
	EffectiveDate,
	EndDate,
	IsReductionOrder,
	Status,
	Description,
	CustomerAuthorizedById,
	CustomerAuthorizedDate,
	CompanyAuthorizedById,
	CompanyAuthorizedDate,
	Type,
	BillingStreet,
	BillingCity,
	BillingState,
	BillingPostalCode,
	BillingCountry,
	BillingLatitude,
	BillingLongitude,
	BillingGeocodeAccuracy,
	BillingAddress,
	ShippingStreet,
	ShippingCity,
	ShippingState,
	ShippingPostalCode,
	ShippingCountry,
	ShippingLatitude,
	ShippingLongitude,
	ShippingGeocodeAccuracy,
	ShippingAddress,
	Name,
	PoDate,
	PoNumber,
	OrderReferenceNumber,
	BillToContactId,
	ShipToContactId,
	ActivatedDate,
	ActivatedById,
	StatusCode,
	OrderNumber,
	TotalAmount,
	CreatedDate,
	CreatedById,
	LastModifiedDate,
	LastModifiedById,
	IsDeleted,
	SystemModstamp,
	LastViewedDate,
	LastReferencedDate
FROM Order WHERE Status = 'Activated' ORDER BY CreatedDate ASC LIMIT 10</Request>

Nodes.Name: ForEach
Nodes.LongDescription: Here we are splitting each order to be processed individually

Nodes.Name: GetKeyValue2
Nodes.LongDescription: Here we check to see if the Order has been processed before by checking if a Key Value record has already been logged for this Order ID.

Nodes.Name: IfVisualBasic
Nodes.LongDescription: Here we are checking if the Order record found in the Key-Value store contains a Success status

Nodes.Name: Salesforce
Nodes.LongDescription: Here we are fetching the related Order Items for the Order

Properties.Schema:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-16"?>
<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="Request" type="xs:string"/>
</xs:schema>
Properties.Name: Request
Properties.Value:
<Request>SELECT
	Id,
	Product2Id,
	IsDeleted,
	OrderId,
	PricebookEntryId,
	OriginalOrderItemId,
	AvailableQuantity,
	Quantity,
	UnitPrice,
	ListPrice,
	TotalPrice,
	ServiceDate,
	EndDate,
	Description,
	CreatedDate,
	CreatedById,
	LastModifiedDate,
	LastModifiedById,
	SystemModstamp,
	OrderItemNumber
FROM OrderItem WHERE OrderId = '{OrderID}'</Request>

Nodes.Name: Salesforce
Nodes.LongDescription: Here we are fetching the Customer Details based on the AccountId

Properties.Schema:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-16"?>
<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="Request" type="xs:string"/>
</xs:schema>
Properties.Name: Request
Properties.Value:
<Request>SELECT
	Id,
	IsDeleted,
	MasterRecordId,
	Name,
	Type,
	ParentId,
	BillingStreet,
	BillingCity,
	BillingState,
	BillingPostalCode,
	BillingCountry,
	BillingLatitude,
	BillingLongitude,
	BillingGeocodeAccuracy,
	BillingAddress,
	ShippingStreet,
	ShippingCity,
	ShippingState,
	ShippingPostalCode,
	ShippingCountry,
	ShippingLatitude,
	ShippingLongitude,
	ShippingGeocodeAccuracy,
	ShippingAddress,
	Phone,
	Fax,
	AccountNumber,
	Website,
	PhotoUrl,
	Sic,
	Industry,
	AnnualRevenue,
	NumberOfEmployees,
	Ownership,
	TickerSymbol,
	Description,
	Rating,
	Site,
	OwnerId,
	CreatedDate,
	CreatedById,
	LastModifiedDate,
	LastModifiedById,
	SystemModstamp,
	LastActivityDate,
	LastViewedDate,
	LastReferencedDate,
	Jigsaw,
	JigsawCompanyId,
	CleanStatus,
	AccountSource,
	DunsNumber,
	Tradestyle,
	NaicsCode,
	NaicsDesc,
	YearStarted,
	SicDesc,
	DandbCompanyId,
	flowgear__CustomerPriority__c,
	flowgear__SLA__c,
	flowgear__Active__c,
	flowgear__NumberofLocations__c,
	flowgear__UpsellOpportunity__c,
	flowgear__SLASerialNumber__c,
	flowgear__SLAExpirationDate__c,
	flowgear__ExternalId__c,
	flowgear__Location__c,
  (SELECT Name, FirstName, LastName from Contacts)
FROM Account WHERE Id = '{AccID}'</Request>

Properties.Name: Description
Properties.Value: Allows you to retrieve a single contact by Contact Number in a Xero organisation

Properties.Name: ContactNumber
Properties.Value: This field is read only on the Xero contact screen, used to identify contacts in external systems (max length = 50).

Nodes.Name: IfVisualBasic
Nodes.LongDescription:
Here, the Execution Flow follows different paths depending on whether the customer exists in Xero:

* If the customer exists, the invoice is created directly in Xero.
* If the customer does not exist, a new customer is first created in Xero, followed by the invoice creation.

Nodes.Name: QuickMap
Nodes.LongDescription: Here we map the Order Items retrieved from Salesforce to the Xero format before creating the Invoice in Xero.

Nodes.Name: ForEach
Nodes.LongDescription: Here are encapsulating the Invoice object within an array to ensure it is accepted as a valid request payload by Xero.

Properties.Name: Description
Properties.Value: Allows you to create one or more sales invoices or purchase bills

Properties.Name: summarizeErrors
Properties.Value: If false return 200 OK and mix of successfully created obejcts and any with validation errors

Nodes.Name: IfVisualBasic
Nodes.LongDescription: Here we are checking if the Invoice was created successfully in Xero by the Response Code

Nodes.Name: SetKeyValue2
Nodes.LongDescription:
Here we are logging the Key Value record for error records.
We get the Group from the Variable bar.
We use the Order ID as the Key (Notice the fx on the input - you need to select which field in the payload is the Key.)
We use the Xero as the Value.

Nodes.Name: QuickMap
Nodes.LongDescription: Here we map the customer data retrieved from Salesforce to the required Xero format before creating the customer record.

Name: Salesforce Orders To Xero Invoices
Description: This Workflow integrates Salesforce with Xero by retrieving Orders, related Order Items, and Account details. It creates the customer in Xero if needed, generates an invoice, and logs each Order as a success or error.
